channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Bradford child sex abuse: Children 'remain unprotected'
item.description: The report says some children in Bradford have "suffered abuse no child should have to experience".

item.title: Covid patient discharged after 203 days in Norfolk hospital
item.description: Sean Hunte's family was called three times to say their goodbyes to the 58-year-old teacher.

item.title: Simon Bramhall: Liver branding surgeon's suspension 'insufficient'
item.description: Simon Bramhall branded his initials on two patients' livers during operations in Birmingham.

item.title: Northern pool frog project reversing extinction say experts
item.description: The frogs are flown in from Sweden and reintroduced to their old hopping grounds in Norfolk.

item.title: A27 crash: Lorry driver caught on camera texting before collision
item.description: Derek Holland texted and used both hands to peel a banana before a crash which injured three people.

item.title: Suffolk staycation: 'You don't need to go abroad to holiday'
item.description: Those opting to spend the summer in the UK rather than abroad share their experiences.

item.title: Covid: Bradford's Matthew Keenan dies despite changing mind on jabs
item.description: Matthew Keenan, 34, from Bradford, urged others to get vaccinated after his Covid diagnosis.

item.title: Oldham killer who daubed victim's body in nail varnish is jailed
item.description: A man who stabbed his girlfriend to death before scrawling "it was me" on her body is jailed.

item.title: Channel crossings: People smugglers 'using smaller boats as a diversion'
item.description: Small dinghies distract police while larger boats cross the English Channel, a French MP says.

item.title: Wasp nest found in Peterborough toilet cistern
item.description: Thousands of wasps set up home in a toilet cistern while the owner is briefly away.

item.title: Home Office to investigate deportation of Chinese sailors after WW2
item.description: An MP says investigating why Chinese sailors were deported from Liverpool is a "step in the right direction".

item.title: Greater Manchester Police branded 'institutionally racist'
item.description: A report into race equality issues at Greater Manchester Police highlights a range of failures.

item.title: Rapist Anthony Burn jailed for life for abuse spanning 40 years
item.description: The seven victims in Northumberland and Cambridgeshire suffered a "horrendous ordeal", police say.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: New agricultural techniques trialled in Devon
item.description: A South West nature reserve is pioneering new agricultural techniques as part of a UK-wide scheme.

item.title: Prince Philip: 'Surreal' letter from palace after royal portrait
item.description: Honor sent a painting to the Queen after the prince's death and was surprised at the response.

item.title: Woman hikes up 88 Peak District hills in memory of mother
item.description: Lucy Coppack climbed to honour her mum, who designed one of the trig pillars marking the highest points.

item.title: Multiple sclerosis: Parkour athlete's loss of mobility 'mortifying'
item.description: Luke Callinan, 35, has been diagnosed with a rare form of multiple sclerosis.

item.title: Weed garden wins RHS gold at Tatton Park flower show
item.description: The team behind Weed Thriller want to show that native plants are essential for wildlife.

item.title: Art installation unveiled in Brighton in memory of Covid victims
item.description: Souls to Paradise is on display for a week and takes the form of a giant flock of folded paper cranes.

item.title: Yeovil stabbing: Accused filmed Snapchat video 'confessing murder'
item.description: Father-of-five Louis Bednall was fatally stabbed during a visit to a friend's flat, a court hears.

item.title: Goose Fair: Entrance fee row threatens historic event's return
item.description: The organiser says "we will have it the way it's always been, or we won't have it at all".

item.title: Huyton shooting: Police release image of suspected gunman
item.description: Dad-of-two Patrick Boyle was shot in the chest in Huyton on 1 July and died later in hospital.

item.title: Gorleston missing woman: Suspect arrested in murder inquiry
item.description: Patricia Holland, 83, described as "vulnerable", was last seen at her home on Saturday night.

item.title: Whipps Cross Hospital cancels operations after flooding
item.description: Appointments at Whipps Cross have also been rearranged with some to be held virtually.

item.title: Biles praised for prioritising mental health after pulling out of Olympic gymnastics final
item.description: American gymnast Simone Biles is praised for prioritising "mental wellness over all else" after pulling out of the Olympic women's team final.

item.title: Brilliant Bairstow checks out with another scintillating display for Welsh Fire
item.description: Jonny Bairstow's 72 from 39 balls sets up a second win for Welsh Fire as they overcome Southern Brave

item.title: The Hundred: Smriti Mandhana secures victory for Southern Brave
item.description: India star Smriti Mandhana hits an unbeaten 61 as Southern Brave race to a comfortable win against Welsh Fire.

item.title: What's happened on day four at Tokyo 2020?
item.description: Tom Dean takes gold ahead of compatriot Duncan Scott as Great Britain makes its best ever start to an Olympics.

item.title: Raphael Varane: Man Utd confirm agreement with Real Madrid to sign defender
item.description: Manchester United confirm they have reached an agreement to sign France defender Raphael Varane from Real Madrid.
